chat.common

Class VectorClock

  • java.lang.Object
    • chat.common.VectorClock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable

    public class VectorClock
extends Object
implements Serializable, Cloneable
    This class defines a vector clock with a Map. A vector clock is serializable to be inserted in messages and is cloneable for copying to/from messages.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • invariant

        public final boolean invariant()
        checks the invariant of the class: scalar clock are greater than or equal to 0. NB: the method is final so that the method is not overriden in potential subclasses because it is called in the constructor.
        Returns:
        a boolean stating whether the invariant is maintained.

      • getEntry

        public Integer getEntry(Integer key)
        gets the value (integer) of the clock of a process (integer key). The returned value is either the value found or the default value 0.
        Parameters:
        key - the identifier (integer) of the process.
        Returns:
        the clock value.

      • setEntry

        public Integer setEntry(Integer key,
                        Integer value)
        sets the value (integer) of the clock of the process (integer key). If the corresponding key does not already exists in the map, it is inserted.
        Parameters:
        key - the identifier (integer) of the process. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown in case of a negative value.
        value - the value of the clock.
        Returns:
        the new value.

      • incrementEntry

        public void incrementEntry(Integer key)
        increments the clock of a given process (integer). If the corresponding key does not already exists in the map, it is inserted with the value 1, that is to say as if it were 0 before the call.
        Parameters:
        key - the identifier (integer) of the process.

      • clone

        public Object clone()
        Overrides:
        clone in class Object

      • max

        public void max(VectorClock other)
        computes the maximum of the vector and the one provided in the argument. If a given key exists in one of the vector but not in the other, the value is set to the one that is present.
        Parameters:
        other - the other vector clock for the computation.

      • isPrecededByAndFIFO

        public boolean isPrecededByAndFIFO(VectorClock other,
                                   int sender)
        states whether this vector is clock is preceded by the vector clock provided in the argument other, except for the entry sender, for which the corresponding value in this vector clock is the next one to be received (compared to other). This condition is for testing of the causal relationship (that includes the FIFO property [no hole]) before the reception. More precisely, considering a message with a vector clock provided in the argument other and the identity of the sender of the message, it states whether the following condition is true:
        • for the entries of the vector clocks that corresponds to the sender of the message, the value of this vector clock (this.getEntry(sender)) is one step behind the value of the message vector clock (other.getEntry(sender)), and
        • for all the other entries (key) of the vector clocks, the value of this vector clock (this.getEntry(key) is preceded by the value of the message vector clock (other.getEntry(sender)).
        Parameters:
        other - the vector clock of the message.
        sender - the sender of the message.
        Returns:
        the boolean of the condition.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
